node.title: Meet the American teen tracking Russian oligarchs' jets
node.description: "It would be pretty cool to see one of their planes seized," said 19-year-old Jack Sweeney of his plane-tracking algorithm.
node.content: ["Jack Sweeney first attracted public attention after starting a Twitter account devoted to\u00a0tracking\u00a0Tesla founder Elon Musk's private plane. Now the teenage college student has a new pet project involving another set of billionaires: publicizing the movements of private jets owned by Russian oligarch.", "\"It would be pretty cool to see one of their planes seized,\" Sweeney, 19, told CBS MoneyWatch in discussing his Twitter account,\u00a0@RUOligarchJets, or Russian Oligarch Jets.\u00a0", "Sweeney, a first-year student at University of Central Florida, said the account is based on an algorithm he developed that taps publicly available records of jet ownership and flight data to track about 30 private jets belonging to Russian oligarchs. The teenager said he was inspired to create the service following Russia's attack on Ukraine, when people on social media asked him if he could use the algorithm used to track Musk to monitor Russian oligarchs' private aircraft.", "\"People want these people tracked down and have their assets tracked down and to take their yachts and jets,\" Sweeney said.\u00a0", "Since Sweeney started the service to track Russian oligarchs' jets, the Twitter account has swelled to more than 340,000 followers.", "The term \"oligarch\" \u2014 denoting a small group in government who exercise control, usually for corrupt purposes \u2014 has been used to describe the enormously rich business elite in Russia whose wealth is suspected of having been gained chiefly through their political connections to members of government, including via privatization of state assets.", "In his State of the Union address, President Biden\u00a0said\u00a0the U.S. and its allies are waging economic war on Russian President Vladimir Putin over the country's invasion of Ukraine as well as Russian oligarchs who are viewed as supporting him. On Wednesday, the Justice Department\u00a0announced\u00a0the formation of a new task force that would target the oligarchs.\u00a0", "\"We are joining with our European allies to find and\u00a0seize your yachts, your luxury apartments, your private jets. We are coming for your ill-begotten gains,\" Mr. Biden said.", "The Russian Oligarch Jets account's most recent tracking data shows that a jet owned by Leonard Blavatnik, who holds U.S. citizenship but was born in Russia, on Thursday flew from Newburgh, New York, to Liberia. Blavatnik earned $7 billion by selling a stake in a Russian oil venture in 2013. He is now the world's 34th richest person, with a net worth of almost $38 billion, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index.\u00a0", "Sweeney is also tracking Putin's private aircraft at @PutinJet, although the flight data so far is only for travel within Russia.", "Leonard Blavatnik's Jet N600EB Took off near Newburgh, New York, US. Going to Liberia, Guanacaste, CR (LIR, Daniel Oduber Quiros International Airport) arriving in ~4h27m. pic.twitter.com/DDEySPAJtu", "Other private jets tracked by Sweeney include planes owned by Roman Abramovich, the Russian billionaire who this week said he would sell the Chelsea soccer club and donate the proceeds to victims of the Ukraine invasion, and Leonid Mikhelson, CEO of Russia's largest natural gas provider.\u00a0", "\"They have huge planes \u2014 some of them are just continuing to fly, they aren't stopping,\" Sweeney said, noting that one of the planes is a commercial Boeing 787.", "Owning and operating a Gulfstream GIV for private business use can cost anywhere between $30 million to $50 million per year, depending on the hangar services and whether one buys a new or used plane, according to Honeywell Aerospace. The private jet version of the Boeing 787 can cost more than $200 million, Business Insider reports.", "Sweeney, who is studying information technology and aims to get a job in software engineering in the aviation industry, said he isn't worried about threats or his safety since he's in the U.S. He said he'll track more jets if he finds information on them.\u00a0", "As for Musk \u2014 who tops Bloomberg's rich list\u00a0with a fortune estimated at $226 billion \u2014 Sweeney said he's still tracking his plane. He also said Musk offered him $5,000 to shut down the account, but that he declined.\u00a0", "\"I'm not going to take it down for just $5,000,\" he said, noting that he made a counter-offer of $50,000 or a Tesla. \"He said it doesn't feel right \u2014 then all the news got out and he blocked me.\""]
